title: 1337.study
longDescription:
1337.study is a spaced-repetition-based LeetCode studying platform. Using the SuperMemo 2 algorithm, it optimizes the review process by scheduling problems at increasing intervals, optimizing material retention. The platform tailors practice schedules to individual performance, ensuring effectiveness for learners of all skill levels.
The frontend is a SPA made with React Router in declarative mode. LeetCode has no public API, so a Playwright-based scraping approach was used on the backend to gather problem set questions.

features.title: Client-side Persistence
features.description: 1337.study doesn't rely on the server to store user progress. Instead, question properties are stored using localStorage with Zustand's persistence middleware.

features.title: SM-2 Algorithm
features.description: SM-2 is a popular spaced repetition algorithm, famously used by the flashcard program Anki and originally used in SuperMemo 2. Spaced repetition intervals are determined using my TypeScript implementation.

features.title: LeetCode Scraper
features.description: LeetCode doesn't provide a publicly accessible API for study plan questions. To support study plan imports, I used a scraping approach to extract problem information from public pages.

features.title: React Router
features.description: React Router in declarative mode was used to handle the required routes for this single-page application.

process.description: Researched proven approaches for studying and arrived at spaced repetition. Decided to use the SM-2 algorithm, inspired by Anki, and implemented it in TypeScript.
Designed the user dashboard around a set of mock data. Used shadcn/ui components to reduce iteration time.
Set up the problem set scraper and replaced mock data with functional API calls. Extensively tested newly added features.
